topic.title: Asking for help: Book request
topic.body: I don't know if this would work, but I still want to have a try to ask for a help here. Could anybody help me find the digital version (e.g pdf/djvu or other format) of Lateinische Grammatik Band 2 by Leumann/Hoffmann/Szantyr? If found, please upload it to Library Genesis, thank you! Gratias tibi ago, et deus te benedicat!

1_19RUZHcaNj247EGGxFXopJyaLwvcMPsYLZ.body:
> [akito](#comment_384_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): What is so special about this book that you can't accept any other? One master piece of a guide to Latin is e.g. Grundwissen Lateinische Grammatik by Langenscheidt.

Thank you, but the problem is I can't find this book either.

> [akito](#comment_386_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): You can't afford to pay the 12 bucks for it? I think it's worth it. If you really HAVE to get it as an ebook then I don't know if there are any Latin ebooks out there, since this language isn't "the hot stuff" when people decide which secondary language to study.

It's only 12 bucks? WOW. I thought it must be at least 120 Euro like that book by Leumann.
